title: Jason Momoa recalls his race to airport after almost sleeping through his daughter's birth
text:
USA TODAY

Jason Momoa – known for playing the heroic title role in "Aquaman" – confessed he had an action-packed experience in real life when he almost missed the birth of his daughter.

The 40-year-old recalled the hilarious and thrilling story of his mad dash from Canada to witness his daughter's birth in an Esquire article published Wednesday.

“It was the hottest day, July 20,” began Momoa, who at the time was in Vancouver filming the series "Stargate Atlantis." “There was no air-conditioning in these places, so I was sleeping in the front window. I missed about 70 calls. And I woke up and freaked the (expletive) out."

Upon realizing daughter Lola 's birth was imminent, Momoa, like Aquaman, sprang into action.

"So I call the Stargate office, and the badass producer is there, and he’s like, 'Jason, get in the (expletive) car, get to the (expletive) airport!' "

More:Jason Momoa's fans clap back at body shamers: 'Go home, Internet'

Momoa took the advice and laid down the law when he boarded the plane.

"So there’s one seat left on the (expletive) back of the plane," he continued, "and I tell the lady, 'Listen, I’m having a baby – make sure everyone sits down so I can get off the plane first.' "

When they finally landed, Momoa went full action star.

"So I come barreling out of the terminal, like the Predator, like, ‘GET OUT OF THE WAY!' "

He continued: “I’m running through the airport, and I get in the car. I go, like, ‘Dude, I don’t care, run all the lights. … I’ll pay for everything.’ And I made it in the nick of time."

Despite his heart-pounding race to Lisa Bonet, who was about to give birth, Momoa said he ended up having "two hours with her in the tub" before their "baby girl was born."

But, according to Momoa, that wasn't even the highlight of the story.

"Oh, and this is the best part!" he added. "Benjamin Bratt (from 'Law & Order') was on the plane! He was in first class. And when I ran past him, I’m like, 'Oh, (expletive), Benjamin Bratt!' And he was like, 'Go, go, go.' "

More:Zoe Kravitz as Catwoman: Jason Momoa 'stoked' for role; Anne Hathaway, Michelle Pfeiffer react

Momoa and Bonet, 51, began dating in 2005 and have two children together: Lola, who's now 12, and 10-year-old Nakoa-Wolf. News broke in 2017 the couple had officially married. The "Game of Thrones" alum also became a stepfather to Zoë Kravitz.
